reviewText: In all fairness I will judge just the 3 documentaries: Dead Homiez, City of the 187, and Livin' with Colors and not include the fourth volume of nothing but jumping cars. The acclaimed Dead Homiez is partly artistic freedom and mostly true to life gangbangers telling the youth to look elsewhere. Despite the mildly offensive insult to any non black culture (primarily Koreans for owning stores and Caucasians for existing in the background), this is a reaffirmation of the "Code Of Thug Life" where the only outlets are death, jail, or a heavy conscience. The soundtrack is very well done and a few freebies can be found by the associated artists online. Volume 2: City of the 187 is less story oriented and is more like Hood 2 Hood: The Blockumentary or Gangbangin Fo Life: Out on Bail, Vol. 2 series. The third volume is the weakest of the series aside from the nonsensical 4th which is not included in this release. All in all, if you choose to own the first or the second volumes, buy the trilogy, you will not regret the purchase.
